name: mick
text: Yeep!

name: porquechutzpah
text: A comment left by porquechutzpah was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by joeyramoney, apocowarg, Darthemed)

name: overmedicated
text: Cropes reminds me of Dr. Kovac in cat form. Only homicidal.

name: andrew_
text: I imagine someone has written ER fan fiction where Dr. Kovac is, in fact, homicidal.

name: jhaela
text: Nice Pete now (not young Pete) has the same hairstyle as Nick Cave now.

name: zeroasalimit
text: I dunno who scares me more.

name: pa_ass_nts
text: Get Nice Pete to make a western, then we will know.

name: bex
text: He actually sort of did!

name: godfatherofsouls
text: Nice Pete always seems to me like a character from And the Ass Saw the Angel.

name: rowboat
text: Do-Not-Forget-Your-Brother-Reply

name: apocowarg
text: I know a guy named Randy who looks very similar to Young Boy Nice Pete. Randy's father used to make him vacuum the trees in the front yard with the hose attachment. Now he works in tech support and wears bathrobe in front of company.

name: apocowarg
text: Just for clarification, his father did this as a busy-work punishment, not because he thought that's how you clean trees. He also made him sweep the yard with a broom.

name: saucy_jack
text: That is such a surreal punishment.

name: toast
text: How do you clean trees, anyway?

name: tekende
text: Infrequently, at best.

name: ssddr
text: I like how the dog appears to be holding his tail high. All full of enegrgy and excitement, blissfully unaware of what awaits him.

name: dans
text: A comment left by dans was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Overmedicated, Jesler729, relaxing, Spenham)

name: centipede_damascus
text: A comment left by centipede_damascus was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by professorhazard, rascaldom, Audhumla, toughasnails001)

name: deancain29
text: Young Nice Pete looks a little like Hitler.

name: tekende
text:
I am there

And the Jews are there

And I place their bodies in ovens

And I am the winner


I am sorry, Assetbar, I couldn't resist

name: laserblade
text:
I am there

And Terri Schiavo is there

And I pull the feeding tube out of her stomach

And I am the winner

name: tragicone
text: wow, was that really the best you could do for on-topic humor?

name: prettyrad
text: His Hitler hairdooo is makin' me feel ill...

name: tekende
text: And we have crashed his party

name: tombsgrave
text: The cycle of job/dog/shoot is a vicious one.

name: wae
text: I watched "American Beauty" last night, and for some reason this strip really seems to make sense in that context.

name: joeyramoney
text: i do not know what to make of the last panel.

name: slab64
text:
Then you must not have grown Pubics

Or else your father is Soft

name: aliiis
text: well, he is Five

name: canusdivinus
text: Peanut sticks up for her man.

name: gmm
text: In it's own way, it's one of the most disturbing panels in Achewood ever

name: gormster
text: The Cropes family buy a new dog every time Daddy gets a new job.

name: snoozebar
text: Are...are they eating the dog?

name: relaxing
text: No. That would be wrong .

name: saru
text: I interpreted it as a mercy killing, since they couldn't feed it otherwise.

name: cypher
text: The fact that Nice Pete's surname is an anagram of 'corpse' is something I never noticed before now...

name: trollcollins
text: My mind is not quite blown, but it is definitely a sexy bit of intellectual heavy petting.

name: zaratustra
text: Why buy? Just get one from outside.

name: shoinan
text: What makes it is the capital 'P' in Pubics.

name: envika
text: what makes it is the word "pubics".

name: slab64
text: Circumstances

name: rachel
text:
nice pete's head is terrifyingly larger than the rest of his body

damned awkward pubics growing teenagers

name: stormagnet
text: Maybe he has somehow caught the inverse of the disease that killed his dad.

name: molesticide
text:
how do you just SUDDENLY notice that?

mine took an amount of time sufficient that i was aware of the occurrence as it happened.

however, daddy still killed me for sure anyway.

name: echidnaboy
text:
I don't remember getting Pubics, neither as a sudden realisation or a long drawn-out process. Maybe the experience was so traumatic I've mentally blocked it out.

Hair all sproutin' from my nether regions
All curlin' up as it grows longer

name: unfun
text: I don't remember it either. I wonder if this is a thing for people.

name: boredom_man
text: I remember it. However, I was a fancypants Georgia city-slicker. The honest boys of West Virginia presumably work too hard to notice their Pubics before they's fully grown.

name: snowbeat
text: poor Mom-mom. Her eye will not stop weeping.

name: professorhazard
text: How Li'l Pete can fear his tiny-headed father is beyond my ability to reckon.

name: direhaggis
text: The backyard must have doubled as a pet cemetery.

name: ultimatio
text: The alt text makes this one for me.

name: daidai
text: Multiple layoffs have apparently led to multiple West Virginian dog burials...if Nice Pete intentionally used the word "always" in panel 3...

name: canusdivinus
text: Anyone else realize the implications of cats owning dogs? For serious?

name: wonelove
text: I think by the time little Nice Pete grew pubics his father's head would have been deathly miniscule.

name: carlyle
text: He could just, you know, not tell his dad about his pubic development.

name: tekende
text: Probably wouldn't do any good. Nice Pete's family seems like the sort that would regularly check the children over for ticks and such.

name: greenkoolayd
text: joke is on you guys; i didnt have a dad growing up.  i grew all the pubics i wanted without fear.
